job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Waco, TX
pros: I was a counselor at the KCF office for 3 years and a case manager for 2. The staff are all so helpful, so kind, and treat you like family. I felt valued for the work I did. There is a nice team atmosphere. It's great to work in a place with so many services to meet the families' needs and to know I can trust the staff meeting those needs such as psychiatry, family partner and case management. My feedback to supervisors and management was welcome and they are open to input. They are flexible. I have had wonderful supervisors and the directors are very receptive, responsive, approachable, and understanding. I received high quality training at the expense of the company to make sure I could do my job effectively. It was not stressful and the expectations are reasonable. I had everything I needed to do my job effectively such as a fully supplied play therapy room to do Child Centered Play Therapy. The 401K benefits (one of the best matching rates out there 12%), health insurance, and life insurance are all great at no cost to me were all great! The workplace is very diverse and they are welcoming of staff and clients of all races, sexual orientations, gender identities, religions, national origin, disabilities you name it. They care about you as a person, not just an employee.
cons:
The salary could be higher, but wasn't too unreasonable for the area and the benefits make up for it. I started at about $47,000 a year. They also just added incentive pay for reaching your billable hours and it's totally reasonable to attain. We got a new executive director in 2019 and he has been very receptive to employee input and has been working on increasing salary. They have already made a $5,000 salary adjustment for case managers. 

The system for entering notes was quite tedious, but they had just switched to it and were still working on improving it. You are also given adequate time to get the notes done.

pros: Limited micromanagement. Good training. Great entry level position with lots of opportunities to learn. Nice benefits (if you can afford to contribute)
cons: Caseloads are too large. Expectation is not realistic. Stakeholders can prevent you from being effective. No overtime. Most people work off the clock. Common for staff to have second job because salary is so low. Middle and upper management do not leave their positions, so hard to move up.

review_title: Loved the clients, did not like my team
pros: I enjoyed the clients that I worked with. In addition, as a brand new case manager, I learned a lot!
cons: Lack of adequate training in my team. The team I was on was disorganized and not professional.

pros: Great experience crisis counseling; partially remote; travel to surrounding counties required.
cons: Lots of turnover; many of programs we could recommend had wait-lists

pros: You get good first hand, hands on experience.
cons: Not enough pay/incentivizations for the work required.

review_title: Entry work only (1-2 years then move on)
pros: Good starting pay, average rate PTO (3 weeks earned a year, roll over), holidays, friendly work environment, casual work and dress
cons: Pay will only increase if you work beyond already tight billing goals (122%). They do not offer bereavement or maternity/paternity leave, so you must use PTO. Goals are very tight, despite issues and limitations that upper management has not desired to address.

pros: Co-workers made it better for me.
cons: 2500 deductible for health insurance, have to wait 6 months to use PTO, led by grant money, ran by business people not people with human service degrees

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Waco, TX
pros: Excellent benefits including 100% health insurance premiums paid by agency, 401k is unbeatable with a 12% match of your salary if you put in 4% of your salary, fulfilling work with a typically low income population in need of quality care, great PTO
cons: Lower pay but that is compensated with excellent 401k, lots of changes, high turnover in many positions. PTO given is competitive however it includes sick time, vacation, bereavement, and maternity leave since there is no maternity leave offered. Most people use short term disability (which has to be purchased out of paycheck) to ensure they are paid when they have a baby.

pros: MHMR is an excellent source of community mental health programs ranging from counseling, crisis, IDD services, jail diversion, veteran related services, and the list goes on.
cons: MHMR could benefit more by providing competitive wages to secure long term employment with invested mental health professionals.

review_title: Have to have a bachelor's degree or above to get hired.
job_title: Licensed Chemical Dependency Counselor(LCDC) in Waco, TX
pros: You get free supervison if your working on a practicum or internship hours for your masters degree.
cons: Some of the departments tend to judge those with substance use and won't help them when they have mental health problems due to their addiction.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Waco, TX
pros:
Great staff 
Great communication
Great hours
cons:
Regularly worked overtime since pay is so low 
Almost impossible to receive raises unless you’ve been an employee for at least 5 years

pros: It has a good benefit package
cons: The company culture is slow to change

pros: Great Retirement, Good Paid Time Off
cons: Poor Upper Management, Low Pay Rates

pros: Very talented professionals to work with.
cons: Administration is oppressive. Pay is poor. Working environment is very substandard. Treatment of physicians is very poor.

pros: The people within MHMR are wonderful. You get to make a real difference in the life of someone who needs help.
cons: Working with difficult consumers is exhausting.

pros: You can work from home
cons: They expect a lot. Lots of deadlines for not a lot of pay.

review_title: Great place to work and to make a difference.
pros: The people at HOTR MHMR are caring, competent, and creative.  You will have many opportunities to help those in need and you will get to use problem solving skills.  On a daily basis you will be a detective, counselor, and community resource guru for the clients you help.  This is a great position for a new college graduate looking to get experience in the field of psychology and/or social work.
cons: Being a quasi-state agency, there is a lot of paperwork and change occurs often. Stress levels can be high when a client is in crisis.

pros: The employees are great to work with. Everyone is very helpful. I have made great friends while working with this center. The benefits are decent. PTO is great as you earn hours every month. And they also have a great retirement plan. If you invest at least 4%, they will match you 12%.
cons: The pay is horrible for the amount of work you do. You always live pay check to pay check. There is extremely high turnover for this reason.

job_title: Case Manager I in Waco, TX
pros: The retirement plan is very good. You get to help people who really need it. Peers and middle management tend to all get along and have a good understanding of each other.
cons: Upper management has little to no understanding of the workload of it's employees. MHMR frequently does what's best for their bottom line rather than what's best for its clients or employees. High turnover rate among employees.

job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Waco, TX
pros: education on mental health, understanding toward employees with disabilities,
cons: limited advancement opportunities in professional positions for people with a mental health disability but in recovery, lack of minorities in supervisory/management roles

pros: Relatively relaxed atmosphere.  Casual (not even business casual) dress - I wore pearl snap shirts and blue jeans.  Very good benefits.
cons: They are always short on money.  Salaries are far below average.

review_title: Good place to make a difference
job_title: Qualified Mental Health Processional in Waco, TX
pros: I enjoyed working with my clients. I truly felt like I was helping and got to learn so much from them in return.
cons: Large caseload, pay is low (enough to make ends meet but no room to add to savings)

pros: Lots and lots of PTO days.
cons: Low pay, and very low morale.

pros: Flexible hours, Great co-workers, awesome benfits
cons: low salary, all year work
